title: Plücker embedding
summary: In mathematics,  the Plücker map embeds the Grassmannian G r ( k , V ) {\displaystyle \mathbf {Gr} (k,V)} , whose elements are k-dimensional subspaces of an n-dimensional vector space V, in a projective space, thereby realizing it as an algebraic variety. More precisely, the Plücker map embeds G r ( k , V ) {\displaystyle \mathbf {Gr} (k,V)} into the projectivization P ( Λ k V ) {\displaystyle \mathbf {P} (\Lambda ^{k}V)} of the k {\displaystyle k} -th exterior power of V {\displaystyle V} . The image is algebraic, consisting of the intersection of a number of quadrics defined by the Plücker relations (see below).
